Detailed Description

This class represents the design space associated to the current use case.

It contains the API for generating and navigating points witin the design space. It also contains a set of API functions for evolutionary algorithms.

Definition at line 251 of file m3_design_space.h.

)

Returns:
true the representation was feasible

m3_point &  point,
int  i,
string &  res,
int  mode 
)

Converts a two level, boolean factorial representation into a feasible design space point.

Parameters:
env the multicube environment
point the computed point in the design space
i the value of the two level representation (it is the natural integer representation of the boolean vector)
res contains the '+''-' representation of the computed vector.
mode the mode in which the ff has to be used (TWO_LEVEL_FF_MODE_CLASSIC or TWO_LEVEL_FF_MODE_SCRAMBLED)

bool m3_design_space::eval_expression ( m3_env *  env,
m3_point *  x,
string  expr,
bool  is_objective_or_constraint,
double &  value 
)

Evaluates an expression composed.

The expression can be composed of elements x_par or f_x where

x_par is parameter 'par' associated to x. f_x is the metric (or objective) associated to x.

Example:

x_pn < 4 && energy_x > power_x * 8.32

where pn is a parameter and energy is a metric or an objective.

Parameters:
env the M3 env
x the x point to be evaluated.
expr the expression to be evaluated
is_objective_or_constraint a flag reporting if the expression is an objective or a costraint
value the value of the expression
Returns:
true if everything went fine during the simulation.

bool m3_design_space::eval_expression_2 ( m3_env *  env,
m3_point *  x,
m3_point *  y,
string  expr,
double &  value 
)

Evaluates an expression composed of 2 points (x and y).

The expression can be composed of elements x_par (y_par) or f_x (f_y) where

x_par is parameter 'par' associated to x. f_x is the metric (or objective) associated to x.

same for y.

Example:

x_pn < y_pn && energy_x > energy_y

where pn is a parameter and energy is a metric or an objective.

Parameters:
env the M3 env
x the x point to be evaluated.
y the y point to be evaluated.
expr the expression to be evaluated
value the value of the expression
Returns:
true if everything went fine during the simulation.

bool m3_design_space::evaluate ( m3_env *  env,
m3_point *  point 
)

Evaluates a point in the design space computing the associated statistics and metrics by using the problem driver.

The metrics and statistics are attached to the point as properties.

Parameters:
env the M3 env
point the point to be evaluated by using the driver.
Returns:
true if everithing went fine during the simulation.

m3_point m3_design_space::genetic_crossover ( m3_env *  env,
m3_point *  parent_0,
m3_point *  parent_1 
)

Uniform random genetic crossover operator.

Return a point child with position inherited from the two parents. Each Design Space parameter has equal probability to be inherited from one of the parents.

Parameters:
env the M3 env
parent_0 the first parent of the child
parent_1 the second parent of the child
Returns:
the inherited child point

m3_point m3_design_space::genetic_mutation ( m3_env *  env,
m3_point *  mutant,
double  p_gen_mutate = 0.2 
)

Uniform random mutation operator.

Return a point with position mutated from the given one.

Parameters:
env the M3 env
mutant the mutating point
p_gen_mutate the probability of mutation, default 10%
Returns:
the mutated point

int m3_design_space::get_mask_multi_opposite_level_index ( m3_env *  env,
m3_point *  p,
string  parname 
)

Returns the index in mask_opposite_level of a couple of scrambled assignment for the mask whose parameters are specified in t structure.

If no matching mask is found a set of close to scramble operator masks for the given mask.

Parameters:
env the M3 env
p the point to consider
parname the parameter name (which have to be a mask)
Returns:
the index in mask_opposite_level, or -1 if no matching mask is found

m3_point *  p,
string  parname 
)

Returns the index in mask_opposite_level of a couple of scrambled assignment for the mask whose parameters are specified in t structure.

void m3_design_space::insert_on_off_mask ( m3_env *  env,
string  name,
bool  variable_dimension,
string  variable_dimension_parameter,
int  fixed_dimension,
bool  no_on_set_size,
bool  variable_on_set_size,
string  variable_on_set_size_parameter,
int  fixed_on_set_size 
)

Insert an on_off mask into the design space.

Parameters:
env the multicube environment
name the parameter name
variable_dimension true if the dimension is variable
variable_dimension_parameter the name of the scalar parameter that determines the size of the object. At the moment the parameter should be M3_SCALAR_TYPE_INTEGER.
fixed_dimension the dimension of the fixed size permutation
no_on_set_size true if the mask does not have an on set size.
variable_on_set_size true if the parameter has a variable on set size.
variable_on_set_size_parameter the name of the scalar parameter that determines the on set size. At the moment the parameter should be M3_SCALAR_TYPE_INTEGER.
fixed_on_set_size the fixed size of the on set.

void m3_design_space::insert_scalar ( m3_env *  env,
string  name,
int  type,
int  min,
int  max,
vector< string >  list_of_values 
)

Insert a scalar into the design space.

Scalars can be either integers or lists of symbols (also called 'string').

Parameters:
env the multicube environment
name the parameter name
type the type of the parameter (either integer or list). It has the same definition of 'type' field in m3_scalar
min the minimum if the parameter is not a list.
max the maximum if the parameter is not a list.
list_of_values the list of values associated to the parameter.
